author: Alice Medrich
title: ‘The Perfect Cake’ and ‘Cake’ Reviews: Coconut, Carrot, Pound, Layer . . .
text:
Baking is a finicky endeavor, and baking books are the most challenging cookbooks to write because mere details can separate good cake from bad. Knowing how to make a perfect cake is one thing. Being able to communicate that knowledge so that a baker in another kitchen with different ovens and equipment can reproduce it successfully—well, that’s another thing entirely.
“The Perfect Cake,” by the editors at America’s Test Kitchen, does the other thing admirably. It’s a big book, and not pretty. Some may find the realistic-rather-than-artful...
